intro: Saussurea alaschanica, commonly known as the Alaska saffron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh alpine environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in cold and dry conditions. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Saussurea alaschanica is often found in meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations.
